item.title: International Consensus Chess is in public beta!
item.description: Consensus Chess is going through some beta testing on Mastodon, and you can play today!

item.title: International Consensus Games (WIP)
item.description: I’ve been working on a pet project recently: Consensus games are a fun new way to play together through social media…

item.title: Building an AWS Lambda in C#, part 6: Triggers
item.description: In part 5, we amended our Lambda to write to an S3 bucket; and in this part, we’ll explore triggers to run it regularly.

item.title: Building an AWS Lambda in C#, part 5: S3
item.description: In previous parts, we’ve built a Lambda that can query the OpenWeather API, using a secret key; and in this part we’ll extend it to write that data to S3.

item.title: Building an AWS Lambda in C#, part 4: Logs
item.description: In part 3, we extended our Lambda to communicate with an API, using a secret key; and in this part, we’ll explore the logs created when the Lambda runs.

item.title: Building an AWS Lambda in C#, part 3: APIs and secrets
item.description: In part 2, we build a Lambda function, deployed and invoked it; and in this part, we’ll extend it to communicate with an API using a secret key.

item.title: Building an AWS Lambda in C#, part 2: Build, deploy and invoke
item.description: In part 1, we set up the basic infrastructure to support a new Lambda function on AWS; and n this part, we’ll build a Lambda function, deploy it to AWS, and invoke it with some input.

item.title: Building an AWS Lambda in C#, part 1: AWS
item.description: At first glance, Amazon Web Services (AWS) can seem impenetrably complex, but it’s not so bad once you’ve found your way around it…
